adjective.description: Of, relating to, or characteristic of Roman Catholics or the Roman Catholic Church; = "papist". Also as noun: †a Roman Catholic (obsolete).

origin: Mid 16th century; earliest use found in George Joye (1490x95–1553), evangelical author. From post-classical Latin papisticus popish from papista + -icus. Compare Middle French, French papistique, German papistisch.
